subject: Shared data between test methods in a testcase
msgSnippet: ... example my first method ... third that I can update ... [...] I ve been where you are, and for the same reason. Don t do it. Here is my testing pattern for
messageBody:
> I am doing this because I wnat to share data between each test method (for
example my first method
> tests that I can create an EJB object, the next is that I can read it, the
third that I can update
> it and the last that I can delete it).
[...]

I've been where you are, and for the same reason. Don't do it.

Here is my testing pattern for EJBs.

In setUp(), begin a transaction. Perhaps create some data used by many/all
test method.
In each test method, create the necessary data and perform the tests. Factor
out creation of data if you can.
In tearDown(), rollback the transaction. This way, my test data doesn't stay
in the database.

> I am sharing a primary key (which is generated at run time from a database
sequence) which I have no
> way of knowing the value of between one test run and the next.

You should be able to write code in a way that that doesn't matter. For
example, for each ejbCreate() method, write an alternate version that
accepts a primary key rather than generates it. Test that method, since you
can easily pass in the primary key you want. Test all your creation
scenarios using that method. Write a single test to verify that you can use
the generated keys correctly. This should be enough.

At the very least, create the data for each test. Put it in a separate
method, possibly called by setUp(). It's easy and it works.

JBR.
